details.title: Who will rule Tamil Nadu for next five years?
details.content: The fate of Tamil Nadu on who will rule the state for the next five years will be decided on Sunday as the Election Commission of India is set to count the votes polled on April 6 in the state to elect 234 MLAs for the assembly and indirectly elect the Chief Minister by opening the Electronic voting machines at 75 counting centres across the state.

details.title: The political fate of 3998 candidates in Tamil Nadu will be decided today
details.content: A total of 72.78 per cent of voters out of 6.28 crores have cast their votes in the April 6 assembly election. To get their support, a total of 3998 candidates have contested in the 234 assembly constituencies of the state.

details.title: Who will be the next CM of Tamil Nadu?
details.content: The fate of five Chief Ministerial candidates MK Stalin of DMK, Edappadi K Palaniswami of AIADMK, Seeman of Nam Tamilar Katchi, Kamal Haasan of MNM and TTV Dhinakaran of AMK will be decided during the elections.

details.title: Over 35,000 personnel deployed as Tamil Nadu awaits election results
details.content: Two months of heated campaigns, and days of anticipation later, it all comes down to this. Sunday is the day we know the State’s fate for the next five years. (READ MORE)

details.title: Tamil Nadu Elections: This Sunday will go down in annals of TN history
details.content: Eager to make inroads into Tamil Nadu, the BJP too will be keenly awaiting the results. Since the AIADMK’s inception in 1977, Tamil Nadu has only favored bipolar electoral results. (ALSO READ)

details.title: Counting of votes in Puducherry to be taken up in three phases and completed by midnight: Chief Electoral Officer
details.content: The counting of votes for the 30 Assembly constituencies in all the four regions of Puducherry will be taken up in three phases on Sunday and completed by midnight. (READ MORE)

details.title: Celebrations to go online for winning party this year

details.title: Former CM Narayanasamy dismisses exit polls predictions in Puducherry, confident of Congress-DMK win
details.content: Former Chief Minister V Narayanasamy today dismissed the exit poll results predicting NDA comprising of AINRC, BJP, and AIADMK sweeping polls in Puducherry and expressed confidence in Congress-DMK forming the government in the UT. (READ MORE)

details.title: No celebrations, bursting of crackers over election results: Madras HC
details.content: The Madras High Court on Friday appealed to political leaders and the party cadres in Tamil Nadu not to go in for celebrations, including bursting of crackers after the announcement of election results on May 2 or 3, citing the spread of the COVID-19 pandemic. (ALSO READ)

details.title: No celebrations, bursting of crackers over election results: Madras HC
details.content: The Madras High Court appealed to political leaders and the party cadres in Tamil Nadu not to go in for celebrations, including bursting of crackers after the announcement of election results on May 2 or 3, citing the spread of the COVID-19 pandemic. (ALSO READ)

details.title: Counting of postal ballots delayed by one hour in Karur Assembly constituency
details.content:
Counting of postal ballots delayed by one hour in Karur Assembly constituency owing to a date issue. As dates weren't mentioned in few postal ballots, AIADMK agents demanded the officials to put them in doubtful.

But the DMK representatives opposed it. As a quarrel broke out between two party workers, the counting was stopped.

Karur assembly constituency Returning Officer Balasubramanian arrived at the booth and cleared the air. The counting was later resumed by 9 am.

details.title: Vote counting briefly stopped for Virugambakkam constituency
details.content: Vote counting briefly stopped for Virugambakkam constituency in Chennai as only one door was open. Party agents and others started banging the other doors. Officials at the counting center stopped counting and called the police.

details.title: DMK set to storm into power
details.content: MK Stalin-led DMK is all set to return to power in Tamil Nadu after 10 long years as trends continued to indicate a clear edge for the DMK combine over the ruling AIADMK front.

details.title: Difference between DMK and AIADMK is around 1000 votes in around 60 assembly constituencies: ECI website

details.title: DMK leads in 118 seats, minimum for a simple majority in Tamil Nadu Assembly
details.content: The DMK is leading in 118 segments, the minimum for a simple majority in the 234-member Tamil Nadu Assembly and its allies in 19, giving the front a comfortable leeway as counting of votes progressed on Sunday for the April 6 assembly elections. The AIADMK is ahead in 80 seats and together with its partners in 94 constituencies, according to trends made available by the Election Commission for 232 segments till 1 pm.

details.title: Some ray of hope for DMK in Coimbatore
details.content: There is a fray in the edge between DMK and ADMK in Mettupalayam Constituency where the only constituency out of Ten Constituencies in Coimbatore district, DMK is leading so far. At the end of 12th round, DMK candidate TR Shanmugasundaram is leading by only 230 votes margin difference against ADMK candidate AK Selvaraj. At all other nine constituencies, DMK alliance is trailing.

details.title: AMMK's TTV Dhinakaran continues to trail
details.content: At the end of round 10, AIADMK minister Kadambur C Raju maintained a lead of 3820 votes, with 29020 votes, while AMMK's TTV Dhinakaran scored 25209 votes.

details.title: Please celebrate from home: DMK to cadres
details.content: The cadres are simply jubilant. Our leader's advice to the cadres is that let them celebrate from their homes as Election Commission is taking serious note of any violation. We are a responsible political party: TKS Elangovan, DMK, in Chennai.

details.title: Update from Vilathikulam constituency
details.content: By the end of all rounds in Vilathikulam, DMK's GV Markandeyan emerged winner achieving 89130 votes against P Chinnapan who secured 51237 votes, by a margin of 37893 votes.

details.title: Durai Murugan gets a slender lead
details.content: DMK general secretary Durai Murugan takes a slender margin of 57 votes, improves tally after trailing in as many rounds.

details.title: AIADMK's deputy coordinator maintains his lead

details.title: AIADMK minister maintains his lead over Dhinakaran
details.content: At the end of round 13, AIADMK minister Kadambur C Raju maintained a lead of 5728 votes, scoring 36842 votes, while AMMKs TTV Dhinakaran scored 31114 votes.

  • MNM's Ganeshkumar 1193 votes.
  • O Pannerselvam leading by 3638 votes.

details.title: AIADMK candidate wins from a reserved seat
details.content: AIADMK candidate A Bannari wins in Bhavanisagar (SC) constituency contesting against PL Sundaram of CPI. Easwaran S of AIADMK was the incumbent. This is the third consecutive time AIADMK or its allies has won the seat. PL Sundaram contested in the AIADMK alliance in 2011 and won there.

details.title: Its a long, lonely walk for defeated DMK candidate
details.content:
DMK candidate ALS Lakshamanan walks on a lonely road due to unfavorable results in #TNElections2021 in Tirunelveli.

details.title: Update from Puducherry
details.content:

  • BJP won 2, leading in 1.

details.content:

details.title: Victorious CPM candidate receives his certificate
ADMK candidate from Valaparai wins
Another ADMK heavyweight trails
details.content: In a turn at Kinathukadavu constituency, where ADMK's former Minister S Damodharan was getting a lead from the first round, now DMK candidate Kurichi Prabhakaran gets a lead by 4642 votes at the end of 15th round.

details.content:

details.title: Another minister facing defeat?
details.content: AIADMK Minister V M Rajalakshmi trailing by 27937 votes at the end of eleventh round in Sankarankovil constituency. DMK E Raja has got 31758 votes so far.

details.title: WATCH | Election Live with Experts | How were Bengal, TN, Kerala, Assam and Puducherry won?
Palaniswami set for a massive victory
details.content: After 20th round, Chief Minister Edappadi K Palaniswami is leading in Edappadi constituency by 65,548 votes. He has got 1,10,475 votes so far, followed by DMK's Sambathkumar (44,927 votes) and NTK Srirathna (4,557 votes).

details.title: Update from Coimbatore
details.content: N Karthik, DMK's lone sitting MLA from Singanallur Constituency in Coimbatore district in 2016 assembly, trails by 12538 votes at the end of 19th round.

details.title: H Raja continues to trail
details.content: Round 18 of Karaikudi constituency: INC candidate S Mangudi leading by 46124 votes. BJP's H Raja got 29866 votes so far, followed by AMMK' Pandi (21528 votes), NTK's N Durai Manickam (12831 votes) and MNM Rajkumar (6530 votes).

details.title: Former minister wins
details.content: Former PWD minister A Namassivayam of BJP wins Mannadipet constituency defeating A Kumar of DMK by 2751 votes.

details.title: Minister Kadambur Raju maintains his lead
details.content: At the end of round 16, AIADMK minister Kadambur C Raju maintained lead of 4923 votes, scoring 43077 votes, while AMMKs TTV Dhinakaran scored 38154 votes.

details.title: Palaniswami set for a massive win
details.content: After 27 rounds, Chief Minister Edappadi K Palaniswami is leading in Edappadi constituency by 87,640 votes. He has secured 1,50,895 votes. DMK's Sambathkumar has got 63,2550 votes, followed by NTK's Srirathna (6,157 votes).

details.title: Update from Puducherry
details.content: Puducherry former Education minister R Kamalakannan leads in Thirunallar , Karaikal.

details.title: Tamil Nadu BJP chief trailing
details.content: BJP's Tamil Nadu President L Murugan trailing in Dharapuram. After round 15: L Murugan (BJP): 50,856 votes, N Kayalvizhi (DMK): 52,258 votes.

details.title: Minister Sellur Raju ahead in Madurai West
details.content: Sellur K Raju secures 68,406 votes and leads DMK's Chinnamal (63,214 votes) by a margin of 5,192 votes by the end of 26th round in Madurai West Constituency. Five more rounds to go.

details.content: Round five at Viralimalai: AIADMK candidate C Vijayabaskar leads by 6698 votes. He has secured 20769 votes so far against DMK's Palaniappan (14071 votes)

details.content:
• NDA increases lead in 12.

  • Congress: 3 (won 1, leading in 2).

  • Two AINRC rebel candidates contesting as independents G Nehru and P Angalane are leading in Orleampet and Thiruvuvanai, SC constituencies respectively.

details.title: Rahul Gandhi congratulates Stalin
details.content:
Congratulations to Shri MK Stalin for the victory.

People of Tamil Nadu have voted for change and we will, under your leadership, prove to be a confident step in that direction.

Best wishes.

— Rahul Gandhi (@RahulGandhi) May 2, 2021

details.title: Update from Madurai
details.content: Counting for Thirumangalam Constituency resumed after nearly three hours due to discrepancy in EVM numbers. Collector inspecting the center. RB Udhayakumar was leading DMK's Manimaran by a margin of around 612 votes when counting was stopped.

details.title: Former minister wins
details.content: Former Handlooms and Textiles Minister OS Manian wins Vedaranyam constituency.

details.title: VCK general secretary wins
details.content: VCK's deputy general secretary 'Aloor' J Mohamed Shanavas wins Nagapattinam constituency with a margin of 7238 votes.

details.title: Palaniswami maintains his perfect record at Edappadi constituency
details.content: After 28 rounds, Chief Minister Edappadi K Palaniswami is leading in Edappadi constituency by 90,255 votes \. He has secured 1,56,145 votes, followed by DMK's Sambathkumar (65,890 votes).

details.title: Pollachi remains AIADMK stronghold despite DMK campaign highlighting sensational sexual assault and extortion case
details.content:
• Deputy Speaker V Jayaraman wins with a margin of 2088 votes against DMK Candidate K Varadharajan in the total of 23 rounds in Pollachi Constituency.
  • ADMK: 79738 votes.
  • DMK: 77650 Votes.
  • Despite DMK's campaign pointing on Pollachi sexual assault and extortion case, the constituency has been secured by ADMK comfortably.

details.title: Former AIADMK minister, who fought under DMK, wins
details.content: DMK candidate S Muthusamy (72) won against AIADMK's KV Ramalingam by 22,089 votes. Muthusamy, who joined DMK in 2010 after differences with AIADMK leadership, has been MLA four times contesting from AIADMK ticket. He has also severed as minister under Jayalalithaa and MGR.

details.title: Social Distancing goes for a toss
Tamil Nadu School Education Minister wins
details.content: School Education Minister KA Sengottaiyan won for the ninth time contesting from Gobichettipalayam constituency since 1980. He polled more than 20,000 votes more than DMK candidate Manimaran.

details.title: DMK wins Perumbalur
details.content:
Perambalur DMK candidate Prabhakaran won by a margin of 31036 votes.

  • DMK-121882 votes.
  • AIADMK - 90846 votes.

details.title: Counting stopped at another constituency
details.content: Counting for Modakurichi constituency stopped after DMK alleged that invalid votes were also counted as part of postal ballots. BJP's CK Saraswathi was leading with 680 votes in the constituency. Nearly 15,000 votes yet to be counted.

details.title: Update from Puducherry
details.content: AINRC leader and Former Chief Minister N Rangasamy leading in Thattanchavdy, but trailing in Yanam.

details.title: AIADMK wins Salem south
details.content: In Salem south assembly constituency AIADMK candidate Balasubramanian beat DMK candidate Saravanan by 22,609 votes.

details.title: Congress wins Erode East
details.content: In Erode East, Congress candidate Thirumagan Evera, son of EVKS Elangovan, won by more than 8,000 votes contesting against Yuvaraaja of Tamil Maanila Congress.

Independents in second place behind AINRC by leading in five constituencies.

details.title: AIADMK wins Melur constituency in Madurai
details.content: AIADMK's sitting MLA Periyapullan Selvam secures 83,344 votes and defeats the INC candidate T Ravichandran (48,182 votes) by a margin of 35,162 votes

details.title: Will be truthful to you, I will work for you, my thoughts and deeds would be for the people of this state: Stalin to Tamil Nadu voters
details.content:
• DMK president M K Stalin, who is set to become the Chief Minister of Tamil Nadu for the first time, on Sunday thanked the people for voting his party to power and assured them that he would truthfully work for them.
  • Stalin expressed his 'heartfelt thanks' to all the people of the state for mandating his party to govern Tamil Nadu for the sixth time.
  • According to the Election Commission data at 6. 30 pm, DMK was leading in 122 segments of the total 234 in the state and won two seats, which is inclusive of its allies who fought on the party's rising sun symbol. The AIADMK was leading in 74 and won two seats.
  • DMK's allies Congress was leading in 17, the CPI and CPI(M) two each and Viduthalai Chiruthaigal Katchi three. In the past, the DMK had been the ruling party five times, during 2006-11, 1996-2001, 1989-91, 1971-76 and 1967- 71.
  • The people have given their massive support realising that their well-being would be protected if DMK was voted to power, he said in a statement.
  • The victory was a commendation for over 50 years of his party's committed work for the people and state.
  • Also, it was in recognition of everyday hardwork of partymen to fulfill the dream of bringing the party to power, he said.
  • Though they worked to get on to the saddle of power during the lifetime of party patriarch 'Kalaignar' (late M Karunanidhi) it did not happen, but they continued to chase that dream.
  • "I will be truthful to you, I will work for you, my thoughts and deeds would be for the people of this state," he said. He thanked his party workers, cadres and leaders of alliance parties and all those who greeted him.

details.title: DMK wins Musiri constituency
details.content:
• Musiri DMK candidate Kaaduvetti N Thiyagarajan wins by a margin of 26,836 votes against AIADMK candidte M Selvarasu.
  • DMK: 90624 votes.
  • AIADMK: 63788 votes.
  • NTK: 14,311 votes.

details.title: DMK wins second seat at Puducherry
details.content: DMK wins its second seat . DMK South convenor and MLA R Siva wins from Villianur by defeating SV Sugumaran of AINRC by 6950 votes.

details.title: Another update from Puducherry
details.content: Former Minister R Kamalakannan loses in Thirunallar constituency.

details.title: AIADMK wins Yercaud seat
details.content: In Yercaud (ST) assembly constituency AIADMK candidate K Chitra beat DMK candidate C Tamilselvan by 25,955 votes. She won for the second consecutive time.

details.title: Top Tamil Nadu cops visit Stalin
details.content:
Police commissioner Mahesh Kumar Aggarwal and other IPS officers visit #DMK chief #MKStalin at his residence following the #TNElections2021 results.

details.title: DMK's Inigo Irudayaraj wins with a margin of over 52,000 votes in Tiruchy East Constituency
details.content: Inigo Irudayaraj, founder of Christhuva Nallenna Iyakkam, contesting on Arivalayam ticket wins with a margin of over 52,000 votes in Tiruchy East constituency. He has defeated Tourism Minister Vellamandi N Natarajan.

details.title: DMK's Palaniyandi wins Srirangam
details.content: Beating AIADMK's Ku Pa Krishnan by 19,763 votes, DMK's Palaniyandi wins Srirangam. All votes have been counted.

details.title: DMK agents besiege AIADMK candidate Pollachi V Jayaraman, raise slogans
details.content:
DMK agents besieged AIADMK candidate Pollachi V Jayaraman and raised slogans against him and CM Edappadi Palaniswami at GCT in Coimbatore.

DMK agents besieged AIADMK candidate Pollachi V Jayaraman and raised slogans against him and CM Edappadi Palaniswami at GCT in Coimbatore. @xpresstn #ElectionsWithTNIE #Elections2021 #TamilNaduElections pic.twitter.com/7Le0YLPycg

— The New Indian Express (@NewIndianXpress) May 2, 2021

details.title: DMK wins Thiruverambur
details.content:
DMK wins in Thiruverambur. With all the postal votes and EVMs counted, Anbil Mahesh Poyyamozhi beats AIADMK's P Kumar by 49,697 votes. 

Total: 

  • DMK - 1,05,424
  • AIADMK - 55,727

details.title: AIADMK candidate K Radhakrishnan wins in Udumalaipet
details.content: K Radhakrishnan, AIADMK candidate wins in Udumalaipet by 96,893 votes.

details.title: Madurai North Constituency Updates: DMK's G Thalapathy wins by a margin of 22,073 votes
details.content:
DMK's G Thalapathy defeats BJP's P Saravanan by a margin of 22,073 votes.

The BJP candidate is a former DMK MLA from Tirupparankundram who joined the saffron party after being denied a seat. 

Total: 

DMK - 69,767
BJP - 47,694

details.content:
Sitting DMK MLA P Moorthy defeats AIADMK candidate R Gopalakrishnan by a margin of 47,871 votes.

Total: 

DMK - 1,20,459
AIADMK - 72,588

details.title: Edappadi K Palaniswami wins by huge margin from home turf
details.content:
Chief Minister Edappadi K Palaniswami won by a huge margin of 93,802 votes from Edappadi.

details.title: Why Tamil Nadu chose MK Stalin-led DMK over AIADMK this time
details.content: MK Stalin-led DMK is all set to return to power in Tamil Nadu after 10 long years as trends continued to indicate a clear edge for the DMK combine over the ruling AIADMK front.

details.title: BJP's Vanathi Srinivasan defeats MNM founder Kamal Haasan in Kovai South
details.content:
Vanathi Srinivasan defeats Actor Kamal Haasan by a margin of 1,352 votes.

Vanathi (BJP) 53,021,

Kamal Haasan (MNM) 51,669.
